notes.text:
An update for pacemaker is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The Pacemaker cluster resource manager is a collection of technologies working together to maintain data integrity and application availability in the event of failures. 

Security Fix(es):

* pacemaker: ACL restrictions bypass (CVE-2020-25654)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

notes.text: An ACL bypass flaw was found in Pacemaker. This flaw allows an attacker with a local account on the cluster and in the haclient group to use IPC communication with various daemons to directly perform certain tasks that would be prevented if they had gone through configured ACLs. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Red Hat Gluster Storage 3 no longer maintains its own version of Pacemaker. The prerequisite is to enable Red Hat Enterprise Linux High Availability (for RHEL X Server)" repository. The fix will be consumed from RHEL High Availability repository.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
